channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-9486] Use session classloader instead of application loader
item.summary: Use session classloader instead of application loader

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12694951 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Mostly looks good, just had a question wondering should we use loader from 'Utilities.getSessionSpecifiedClassLoader'?

I saw it is introduced by Ferdinand Xu as the loader for session-specific artifacts, but actually not familiar with why, so my suggestion might be invalid. Just curious, though.

Szehon Ho I've considered to use 'Utilities.getSessionSpecifiedClassLoader' but it seemed better to have one in common module using JavaUtils.getClassLoader() which is safe to call without hive-exec or other modules. We modifies SessionState.HiveConf.ClassLoader and thread context loader altogether (at least in hive) and it would be the same. Better idea?
Yea it would probably be better to consolidate them to reduce confusion, but it might be ok as you mentioned its the same. +1

Navis, Ashutosh Chauhan, this change broke webhcat. JavaUtils is not on the classpath of the Launcher task of the remote node executing the job. Why was this change needed in WebHCat? (In JobState specifically)

Changes in JobState was made for completeness sake (of having an uniform way of class loading in Hive), no other particular reason AFAIK. I am fine with just using Class.forName() there instead, since this call is on remote short lived launcher process, where issue described here is likely irrelevant.
Removing fix version of 1.2.0 in preparation of release, since this is not a blocker for 1.2.0.

Sushanth Sowmyan, I never reverted the patch so should actually be marked as fixed (by original commit).
I fixed webhcat to work with this change.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.
